meanings.definition: Tending to hesitate or be reluctant.
meanings.sent1: The baulkier puppy took a long time to approach the new toy.
meanings.sent2: The cat was baulkier than the dog when it came to trying new food.
meanings.sent3: The baulkier child insisted on taking tiny steps towards the water, afraid of getting wet.
meanings.sent4: Her baulkier nature was like a heavy anchor, holding her back from new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The baulkier clouds seemed to stall in the sky, unsure of where to move next.

meanings.sent1: The baulkier box was a challenge to lift onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The baulkier suitcase made traveling more cumbersome.
meanings.sent3: Trying to move the baulkier chair through the narrow doorway was a real struggle.
meanings.sent4: The baulkier car required extra effort to park in the tight space.
meanings.sent5: The baulkier branches made it hard to navigate through the forest.

meanings.sent1: The baulkier student refused to participate in the group activity.
meanings.sent2: The baulkier employee resisted the new company policy.
meanings.sent3: The baulkier cat arched its back, clearly not wanting to be picked up.
meanings.sent4: Her baulkier attitude was like a wall, blocking any attempts to persuade her.
meanings.sent5: The baulkier door seemed to push back against anyone trying to open it.
